intro: Rhomboda bantaengensis, commonly known as the Bantaeng rhombod, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its rhomboidal-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
